text: Didik Prasetyo, known as Didi Kempot (31 December 1966 - 5 May 2020) was an Indonesian singer-songwriter and philanthropist. He was born in Surakarta, Central Java. In 1989 he released his debut album. A few years later he had his breakthrough with the singles "Stasiun Balapan" and "Sewu Kutho". He was known as "The Godfather of the Broken-Hearted". In 2020, he wrote the song "Ojo Mudik" and gave a concert livestreame from his house. It raised $500,000 for the fight against coronavirus disease 2019. Kempot died of cardiac arrest on 5 May 2020 in Surakarta, aged 53. ==References== Category:1966 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Indonesian singers Category:Indonesian writers Category:Singer-songwriters Category:Asian philanthropists Category:Disease-related deaths in Indonesia
title: Didi Kempot
